name: Carnewas at Bedruthan coast walk, North Cornwall

ai.summary: A coastal hike of about 8.6 km along the Carnewas at Bedruthan coast path in North Cornwall, offering dramatic cliff-top views, sea stacks, and a mix of grassy trails and exposed steps. Moderate difficulty suitable for hikers with moderate fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged coastal terrain dominated by cliff-top paths with occasional rocky sections and steps near Bedruthan Steps. Expect uneven footing, potential mud after rain, and exposed, windy open sections. Some shaded woodland portions may appear along the route.
ai.safety_notes: - Cliff edges are exposed; keep a safe distance from the edge and supervise children. - Weather can change quickly on the coast; check the forecast and avoid walking in high winds or rough seas. - Wear sturdy, grippy footwear and stay on marked paths. - Be mindful of tides if the route nears the shore; plan around tide times. - Bring water, sun protection, and a small first aid kit; mobile signal may be limited in remote parts. - Keep dogs on a leash where required and watch for loose rocks and narrow ledges.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof walking shoes with good grip
Layered clothing including a windproof/waterproof jacket
Map, compass or GPS (with offline access)
Phone with emergency contacts and portable charger
Small first aid kit and emergency whistle
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; summers offer longer daylight and milder seas, while spring and autumn provide comfortable temperatures and fewer crowds. Winter hikes are possible but can be challenging due to storms and short days.
